status_message:
First, as a 501c3 organization, We do not endorse ANY candidates or parties. That said, we're compelled to call out the NY Times (which has earned our respect for years with excellent reporting) for its persistent attempts to hurt the campaign of the one presidential candidate who challenges corporate privilege. This is not limited to ongoing attacks by its opinion columnists --it pervades news coverage almost daily. 

Just the latest example: with 3 small states having voted and the Democratic candidates TIED in delegates won, a "news analysis" tries to convince readers the race is all but over with a dishonest article that deliberately tells readers Clinton owns the votes of "superdelegates," which is not accurate. We encourage polite, documented notes of concern to their public editor. See http://nyti.ms/1QW5DXp for email info.
link_name: NY Times Management Fears Bernie Sanders

status_message: The Chicago Tribune documents the routine corruption that we consider normal in our current system of campaign financing.
